experiment_info.name: polar_parameterization
experiment_info.description: Reparameterize source positions using polar coordinates centered on domain centroid
experiment_info.hypothesis: Cartesian (x,y) may have different landscape characteristics than polar (r,theta). CMA-ES may converge faster in one parameterization.

tuning_runs.notes: FAILED - Polar parameterization is WORSE than Cartesian. -0.0216 score, +14.3 min.

conclusion.reason: Polar parameterization does NOT improve CMA-ES performance
key_findings: 2. Time is worse: 72.7 min vs baseline 58.4 min (+14.3 min)
3. Rectangular domain creates irregular search space in polar coordinates
4. CMA-ES covariance adaptation works better with Cartesian coordinates for rectangular domains
5. Bound handling in polar (clipping to domain) introduces discontinuities
conclusion.recommendation: ABANDON problem_reformulation family. Cartesian coordinates are optimal for rectangular domain problems.
